Package pathfinder.textInterface

Class TextInterfaceView

java.lang.Object
pathfinder.textInterface.TextInterfaceView
public class TextInterfaceView
extends java.lang.Object
This is a view that allows interaction with a command-line user through a series of commands. It passes off input events from the user to an InputHandler, which can respond by calling methods of this interface.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TextInterfaceView()
    Creates a new TextInterfaceView, initializing the user's input to the standard input.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void basePrompt()
    Displays a message to the user asking for a top-level command to be entered.
    void begin()
    Transfers thread control to this object, where it blocks between user-input events.
    java.lang.String blockingInput()
    Blocks until the user has inputted an complete line of text, then returns that line of text and resumes operation as normal.
    void exit()
    Shuts down the external view and returns control to whatever method called begin().
    void promptBuildingInput​(java.lang.String buildingName)
    Displays a prompt to the user about inputting a building name.
    void setInputHandler​(InputHandler handler)
    Sets the input handler for this interface, which will be called to respond to all user-input events in the future.
    void showBuildings​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> buildings)
    Displays the list of building information provided to the user, sorted alphabetically by short name.
    void showErrorUnknownBuilding​(java.lang.String building)
    Displays an error to the user about an unknown building.
    void showErrorUnknownCommand()
    Displays an error to the user about an unknown command being used.
    void showMenu()
    Displays the main menu to the user.
    void showPath​(java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end, Path path)
    Displays the proved path to the user.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • TextInterfaceView

      public TextInterfaceView()
      Creates a new TextInterfaceView, initializing the user's input to the standard input. The initialization of this interface must be completed by calling setInputHandler(InputHandler) and providing it an input handler.

  • Method Details

    • setInputHandler

      public void setInputHandler​(InputHandler handler)
      Sets the input handler for this interface, which will be called to respond to all user-input events in the future.
      Parameters:
      handler - The new InputHandler for this interface, which will be called whenever this interface receives user input.

    • begin

      public void begin()
      Transfers thread control to this object, where it blocks between user-input events. The InputHandler that's been provided to this object will be called for input events, if one has been provided. When InputHandler.handleInput(String) returns, if it is called, this method continues blocking indefinitely. To suspend this blocking and shut down this text interface, use exit().
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there's no InputHandler provided to this interface
      java.io.UncheckedIOException - if the user input experiences an I/O error

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Shuts down the external view and returns control to whatever method called begin(). Stops receiving user input. After this method returns, this TextInterfaceView is invalid and should not be used again.
      Throws:
      java.io.UncheckedIOException - if there's an error when shutting down user input.

    • showMenu

      public void showMenu()
      Displays the main menu to the user.

    • showBuildings

      public void showBuildings​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> buildings)
      Displays the list of building information provided to the user, sorted alphabetically by short name.
      Parameters:
      buildings - A mapping from building short names to their long names.

    • showPath

      public void showPath​(java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end, Path path)
      Displays the proved path to the user.
      Parameters:
      start - The long name of the building at the start of the path.
      end - The long name of the building at the end of the path.
      path - The path to show to the user.

    • blockingInput

      public java.lang.String blockingInput()
      Blocks until the user has inputted an complete line of text, then returns that line of text and resumes operation as normal.
      Returns:
      The line of text inputted by the user.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there's no InputHandler provided to this interface
      java.io.UncheckedIOException - if the user input experiences an I/O error

    • basePrompt

      public void basePrompt()
      Displays a message to the user asking for a top-level command to be entered.

    • promptBuildingInput

      public void promptBuildingInput​(java.lang.String buildingName)
      Displays a prompt to the user about inputting a building name.
      Parameters:
      buildingName - The name of the building to use in the prompt.

    • showErrorUnknownCommand

      public void showErrorUnknownCommand()
      Displays an error to the user about an unknown command being used.

    • showErrorUnknownBuilding

      public void showErrorUnknownBuilding​(java.lang.String building)
      Displays an error to the user about an unknown building.
      Parameters:
      building - The short name of the building that's unknown.
